DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Quality of Care Measure Status Description Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The words that describe the state at a particular time for an instrument that determines the magnitude of the degree of excellence with respect to medical services received for the treatment of a tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Quality of Care Measure Status Description
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The description of the state at a particular time for an instrument that determines the magnitude of the degree of excellence with respect to medical services received for the treatment of a tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Quality of Care Measurement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:The degree or grade of excellence with respect to medical services received by patients, administered by providers or programs, in terms of technical competence, need, appropriateness, acceptability, humanity and structure.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

The degree or grade of excellence with respect to medical services received by patients, administered by providers or programs, in terms of technical competence, need, appropriateness, acceptability, humanity and structure.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.:Description; a statement that represents something in words.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.
A written or verbal account, representation, statement, or explanation of something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
